through our University Intern Program. Our program targets college students looking for internships the summer before their senior year. The purpose is to work towards full-time opportunities, for a post-graduation start. \n  <b>We are currently recruiting for the 12-week paid internship program that will run from May 22nd<\u002Fb>\n  <b> <\u002Fb>\n  <b>to August 11th.<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 8,500 dedicated people working more than 40 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation, and emphasizes giving back to the community. To learn more about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <b><br> What can you expect during the internship?<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The 12-week program kicks off with a half day orientation, including an organizational and internship overview, business etiquette, program expectations, policies and conduct. This helps provide foundational knowledge as students move through the program. Over the summer, interns also participate in the following:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Exposure to leadership through information sessions and lunch &amp; learns<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Networking opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Giving back through community involvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manager feedback through midterm and final performance evaluations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Social interactions with other interns and interns from years past<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participation in video ambassador program<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to participate in Employee Resource Group events<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Time to evaluate Celanese for future employment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li><b>Market Analysis: <\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Understand and monitor market trends that affect the use of our products by leveraging data from a wide variety of sources; quantify the impact of trends on the growth outlook of our product segments by region and globally<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicate market insights and their implications for our business strategy to business leadership<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Using advanced analytical tools (e.g., Alteryx, Tableau), maintain and improve pricing forecast models for key product segments<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <li><b> Market Intelligence: <\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Monitor industry supply and demand dynamics, including production rates, consumption, and international trade flows for key product segments to inform real-time tactical business decisions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Leverage advanced analytical tools (e.g., Alteryx, Tableau) and raw material \u002F energy market data to maintain up-to-date view of industry cost position by company and region<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <li><b> Business Strategy &amp; production of specialty materials and chemical products which are used in most major industries and consumer applications. Our products, essential to everyday living, are manufactured in North America, Europe and Asia. Known for operational excellence, sustainability and premier safety performance, Celanese delivers value to customers around the globe with best-in-class technologies. Based in Dallas, Texas, the company employs approximately 7,500 employees worldwide and had 2014 net sales of $6.8 billion, with approximately 67% generated outside of North America. For more information about Celanese Corporation and its global product offerings, visit www.celanese.com.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> The <b>Chemical Operator<\u002Fb> (Process Expert) in production unit will be responsible, with training, for operating and troubleshooting equipment, assisting maintenance, and maintaining environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li>Operate the Vectra polymer production unit to achieve flawless stewardship, quality, reliability, and engagement;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Learn all jobs in the unit including floor operations, control room, and solid state; <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understand and follow all Site and Unit Safety procedures and protocols; <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform all functions necessary to make polymers including operation of all equipment and Distributed Control System (DCS); <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform preliminary troubleshooting on equipment and process malfunctions and be prepared and able to make first attempt repairs where appropriate; <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support maintenance in the unit through LOTO of equipment and issuing Safe Work Permits when required; <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strictly follow all batch recipe sheets and SOCs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain accurate records of all observations and results.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Accurately and thoroughly reporting these data via written (Logbook &amp; PGRs) and oral reports to Vectra Engineers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Enter work notifications into SAP when malfunctioning equipment is identified and initial trouble-shooting completed. production of differentiated chemistry solutions and specialty materials used in most major industries and consumer applications. Our businesses use the full breadth of Celanese's global chemistry, technology and commercial expertise to create value for our customers, employees, shareholders and the corporation. As we partner with our customers to solve their most critical business needs, we strive to make a positive impact on our communities and the world through The Celanese Foundation. Based in Dallas, Celanese employs approximately 13,000 employees worldwide and had 2021 net sales of $8.5 billion. For more information about Celanese Corporation and its product offerings, visit www.celanese.com.<\u002Fp>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <p><br> Celanese has a commitment to building a strong pipeline of talent through our University Intern Program. Our program targets college students looking for internships the summer before their senior year. The purpose is to work towards full-time opportunities, for a post-graduation start. <b>We are currently recruiting for the 12-week paid internship program that will run from May 22nd to August 11th.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b> What can you expect during the internship?<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The 12-week program kicks off with a half day orientation, including an organizational and internship overview, business etiquette, program expectations, policies and conduct. This helps provide foundational knowledge as students move through the program. Over the summer, interns also participate in the following:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Exposure to leadership through information sessions and lunch &amp; learns<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Networking opportunities <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Giving back through community involvement <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Manager feedback through midterm and final performance evaluations <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Social interactions with other interns and interns from years past <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Participation in video ambassador program <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Ability to participate in Employee Resource Group events <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Time to evaluate Celanese for future employment <\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Ful>Responsibilities: \n <p> The intern program is designed to provide students hands on, real world projects and ability to contribute to the continued success of the company! <\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  This position would serve as a project manager or team member for a strategic Supply Chain project in one of the following areas: Manufacturing, Procurement, or Sales and Operations Planning.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <b><br> Procurement Project Example:<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> The interns project was to collaborate with the Business Leaders and a Strategic Sourcing Leader to develop a raw material strategy for one of our products. The intern had the opportunity to meet with key internal stakeholders and external stakeholders (suppliers) and had several meetings and had the chance to interact with suppliers and ask them questions relevant to the project. Also, the intern had the opportunity to seek out and utilize key trade reports and other research that assisted in the development of the strategy. Overview: \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n   Do you like working with your hands? Do you like problem solving and working in a team based, collaborative environment? Want a place with growth potential where you can start a career? If so, Celanese is the place for you! We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team as night shift Production Operators\u002FProcess Experts running our extrusion lines. You will be responsible for equipment changeovers and setups, operation with adjustments, packaging, and minor preventative maintenance tasks.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> In addition, our starting pay is $22.98\u002Fhr with $1.25 shift differential for night shift and potential for advancement. Celanese is a global Fortune 500 Company with a comprehensive and attractive benefits program, health benefits available \n  <b>day 1<\u002Fb>! Our “Total Wellbeing” approach which focuses on Employee Health, Creating Wealth, and Employee Growth helps drive our employee centric culture. Successful candidates will have hands-on experience with hand\u002Fpower tools, operation of a variety of equipment, enjoys troubleshooting, and will be successful in an environment that has unwavering health and safety policies and quality standards.\n <\u002Fdiv> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li>Assume personal responsibility for safety performance and demonstrate a genuine concern for the safety of co-workers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must maintain acceptable housekeeping standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Comply with all safety\u002Fhealth related policies and procedures, participate in company sponsored safety programs and activities, and report to management those conditions or actions by employees or others that might create a hazard to themselves or others in the plant.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Setting up extruders to run a product that is in accordance with standard operating conditions with minimal downtime and loss of product.\n   <ul>\n    <li> This includes the setting of feed totes and product totes. Must be able to learn to use tote tumbling and screw\u002Felement oven equipment.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintaining proper records, which includes run logs\u002Fsheet, feed blends on line, amount of product in totes, packaging reports, work orders, log books and keeping the on-coming operator informed as to important issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completing a product turn-around, which includes cleaning the extruder barrel and screws, the feeder, the chopper, the classifier, the reclaimer system, bagging system, product totes to prevent product contamination. Requires familiarity in the operation and uses of various hand tools.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must successfully complete and maintain a license for operation of a fork-lift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Requires ability to meet the quality expectations for manufacturing.\n   <ul>\n    <li> This includes: Understanding and applying appropriate control techniques, e.g., control charts; as required, accurately sampling the material made so that the laboratory can accurately analyze the physical properties of the product and working with the supervisor to make the necessary corrections to the product to meet specifications.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and understanding of the policies and procedures contained in standard operating procedures, hazardous communication and waste disposal procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshooting processing problems with the product.\n   <ul>\n    <li> This includes, but is not limited to surging, black specks, improper pellet size, pellets with tails, and contaminated product.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> Qualifications: \n <ul>\n  <li>Production experienced preferred, but not required if candidate has mechanical aptitude.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective communication skills required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to deal with hazardous situations and materials.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Basic mechanical and a sound mathematics aptitude which includes the ability to calculate percent's, ratios, unit conversions, averages, as well as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High School education or GED.\n   <ul>\n    <li> 5 years of manufacturing experience may be considered as meeting education requirement.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must maintain a valid driver's license<\u002Fli>\n  <li><b> Environmental, and physical requirements of this position include: <\u002Fb>\n   <ul>\n    <li><b><i>Working (Night Shift) 12 hour shifts and overtime - 4:55 pm - 5:10 am<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n    <li> Working in confined spaces around 300 - 700-degree Fahrenheit extrusion equipment<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Frequent climbing on\u002Foff fork-lift.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Working at elevated heights, regular climbing of stairs and ladders, regular crouching<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to wear a partial respirator to protect against dust and fumes<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Other required protective equipment includes: hard hats, safety shoes, hearing protection, and safety glasses.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to lift 55-pound bags (floor to chest)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Frequent walking, standing and reaching in front of body<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Functional sensory skills, i.e., hearing, sight, speech, smell and feel, full use of both hands, handling, good finger dexterity<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ability to read and comprehend English in training and process documentation<\u002Fli>\n We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation, and emphasizes giving back to the community. develop, manage or participate in project teams as appropriate to achieve desired results in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide HR support to Leadership regarding HR matters including, but not limited to: evaluation of HR policies, legal implications related to employee counseling, conflict resolution, and corrective action (including termination of employment).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This position will support a large non-union manufacturing facility and will have 1 direct report. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>Qualifications: \n <ul>\n  <li>10-15 Years of extensive Senior Level (Director) Human Resource experience required, manufacturing preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum of 5-8 years Multi-site HR Leadership manufacturing experience preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recent progressive and HR experience in a complex organization with diverse cultures, and operating environments, including experience providing forward-facing strategic recommendations and working with senior leadership.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Increasing levels of responsibility to include a broad HR Generalist background with experience in multiple disciplines such as, employee relations, workforce planning, talent management, talent development, performance management, compensation, and more.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in organizational development and change management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment with quickly shifting priorities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated ability to build rapport and influence at all levels of the organization. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven ability to adapt to changing priorities and to manage time effectively.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <b><br> Required Education: <\u002Fb>Bachelor's Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration or related field. Overview: \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com<\u002Fp>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Celanese is looking for a talented, driven and experienced Transformational Change leader reporting to the Senior Director of IT Operations. In this \n  <b>newly created role,<\u002Fb> you will lead the development and execution of change enablement strategies for Global IT in support of Celanese’s digital transformation and inorganic growth agenda. You will develop effective change plans for engaging stakeholders on planned initiatives and working collaboratively to identify and overcome potential obstacles. This leader will assess change readiness and impending impact across the enterprise. The successful candidate will drive business transformation and enable the users to absorb the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> You will be responsible for building a new Transformational Change Management IT organization. The role is both delivery and strategic focused and will lead IT-driven business change in a program\u002Fproject environment as well as helping to promote the charter and benefits of IT overall.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> You will generate standard processes and templates for traditional change management (CM) such as Benefits Statement, Stakeholder Analysis and Engagement, Change Strategy\u002FPlan, Communication Plan\u002FProduct, Change Impact Analysis, Gap Analysis, Training Plan, Production, Presentation, and Strategy\u002FTools to sustain the change. You will also be expected to be creative and leverage communication channels and transformational change tactics that coincide with the Celanese culture and ways of working.\n <\u002Fdiv> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li>Engage with senior business and IT leaders and executives, IT Managers and Program\u002F Project Managers, to drive the change agenda<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Partner with leaders as a subject matter expert and trusted advisor in:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Assessing and classifying the business change to determine the right change strategy and approach<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Ensuring that the appropriate change management tools and methods are applied to IT projects<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Providing expert coaching and advice to help develop change management behaviors to IT professionals involved in project delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive business value and business outcomes through measurable change management activities, for both traditional and Agile deliveries through the project lifecycle and post go-live<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As a senior member of the IT Service Excellence Team, create an environment where members feel motivated, engaged, connected, able to perform to high levels, and to grow and develop in their roles. Onboard, advise, coach, manage, and mentor more junior change managers to build the capability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work closely and collaborate with peers leading change across other areas of Celanese’s business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Equip the business with the skills to better manage and sustain change<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Qualifications: \n <div>\n   Professional and Interpersonal Skills\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Relationship and stakeholder management skills - experience in working as a trusted advisor at senior business leader level on critical, complex challenges<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to influence effectively at different organizational levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Challenge current practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Independent and objective thinker. Resilient and able to manage challenge and resistance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent oral and written presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Skilled in coaching and developing TC and other skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Functional Skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expertise in initiating, leading and managing technology-led change and technology adoption<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expertise in transformational change and change management methods and their application, with emphasis on driving measurable business results<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Agile IT management and Agile IT project delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Change Strategy and Planning, Change Impact Assessment and Change Action Execution, Change Measurement, Stakeholder Management, Communications Management, Change Network Management, Learning Needs, Strategy and Planning, Learning Design, Build, and Execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competency and Knowledge Mgt, Organization Design and Deployment, Culture Design and Behavior Change, Role and Position Design and Deployment, Benefits Analysis, Benefits Management, Value Enablement and Realization<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor's Degree in organizational Change Management, business, technology or equivalent experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Master’s degree preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have 10+ years of relevant work experience with 5+ years of progressive change management experience leading cross enterprise functional diverse teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in leading change in large, complex organization undergoing significant digital transformation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Comfortable managing multiple responsibilities within a fast-paced environment. Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines. Effectively coordinate multiple projects with interrelated teams and technology issues simultaneously within aggressive timelines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Outstanding leadership and organizational skills required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Highly developed communication skills with the ability to articulate and concisely convey ideas<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prior leadership experience working seamlessly in a multinational organization across multiple time zones and cultures<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Celanese is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. polymer compound product and translating them into processing parameters and conditions that maximize performance of the compound; (iii) planning and leading experimental work to develop unique process conditions and identify appropriate process windows for processing polymer compounds in methods such as injection molding, extrusion, and thermoforming; (iv) translating the findings from processing experimentation into reports, technical data sheets, and processing guidelines for new products; (v) researching the technical literature to identify novel technology or science of interest to processing of polymeric compounds, and champion the ideas worth pursuing; (vi) developing effective experimental processing solutions and novel evaluation methods to support new product and application development; (vii) specifying, leading, and championing capital investment projects that enhance processing know-how and capability of the company in different laboratories globally; training content on polymer processing, and delivering training to internal and external customers enabling increased project success rate; and (x) representing the company in industrial technical forums as a subject matter expert in elastomer processing. \n<br>\n<br> \n<b>Qualifications:<\u002Fb>\n<br> Requires a Master’s degree, or foreign equivalent degree in Materials Science or Materials Overview: \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Celanese Corporation is a global chemical leader in the production of differentiated chemistry solutions and specialty materials used in most major industries and consumer applications. Our businesses use the full breadth of Celanese's global chemistry, technology and commercial expertise to create value for our customers, employees, shareholders and the corporation. As we partner with our customers to solve their most critical business needs, we strive to make a positive impact on our communities and the world through The Celanese Foundation. Based in Dallas, Celanese employs approximately 13,000 employees worldwide and had 2021 net sales of $8.5 billion. For more information about Celanese Corporation and its product offerings, visit www.celanese.com.<\u002Fp> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li>Based on project requirements, communicates team member needs to site supervision to execute the project. Provides timing and direction to this team in order to achieve cost and timing of project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads decisions on contracting strategy and selection of contractor(s).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for controlling costs, forecasting spending and reporting schedules to Site supervision. Provides detailed engineering design for plant additions and modifications via contract design group. Coordinates\u002Fmanages contract in-house or off-site engineering and design efforts during engineering, design and drafting phases of project life.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in project Safety Reviews (MSR), Management of Change (MOC) process, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR) and other hand-over activities. Assists in start-up, SOP development and training as required. Responsible for ensuring all engineering, maintenance and operational documentation is filed and available at time of startup. Manages updates to SAP, spare parts selection and stocking efforts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writes specifications for equipment, evaluates vendor’s bids, and selects equipment. Manages these purchases to insure delivery, specification compliance and cost and forecast control. Provides engineering consulting services to Site. Reviews new project feasibility and provides innovative use of technology. Performs technical design reviews for instrument, electrical and analyzer design packages.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversees and manages construction activities related to projects. Checks for compliance with approved specifications and designs. Responsibilities: \n <div>\n   Celanese is looking for a talented, driven and experienced Project Management Office leader reporting to the Senior Director of IT Delivery, Operations, and Office of CIO. In this role, you will lead the delivery of programs\u002Fprojects for Global IT in support of Celanese’s digital transformation and inorganic growth agenda. You will develop effective PMO plans for engaging stakeholders and working collaboratively across IT to identify and overcome potential obstacles. This leader will also be responsible for crafting the agile delivery approach for PMO and maturing the organization to deliver both waterfall and agile projects in parallel. The role is both delivery and strategic focused and will lead IT-PMO into the agile and digitization era.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Leader will transform the PMO by:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <b>Delivery Methodology:<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Work with the business to get buy-in and their commitment to the agile agenda<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Determine the Celanese agile approach and socialize it with the organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the underlying PMO processes can accommodate both waterfall and agile delivery approaches<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Align governance, controls, gates, approvals, etc. to the value proposition <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Optimize the existing waterfall methodology to ensure only value add activities <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Build an agile methodology congruent and customized to the Celanese ways of working<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <b> People:<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Work with change management to ensure the impact of the agile journey is considered<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Determine required training to upskilling existing resources<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recruit\u002Fonboard new resources to supplement the PMO organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Build training and development plans aligned with resource aspirations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop financial analyses of benefits, costs and ensure investments are commensurate with the value derived. Also incorporates non-financial value (risk mitigation, compliance, customer satisfaction, quality, obsolescence, etc.) into program analyses and objectives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Evolve the mindset from on-time\u002Fon-budget to value, benefits, and productivity success metrics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Determine standard ways to define, track, and report value-based metrics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Creating and executing the strategic vision for the PMO <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Lead the PMO organization embodying Celanese goals and fostering career growth<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working closely with the Change Management Office, Vendor Management Office, and Budget Management Office, to implement and administer end to end governance. Establish and instill process alignment with Security and Architecture.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Align project spend and resource requirements by being a key player with the annual planning and budgeting processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organization-wide education on PMO policies, procedures, standards and ensuring consistent application across the PMO by engaging with all levels of leadership on strategy, delivery and portfolio governance performance.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide oversight and guidance on effective and timely execution of programs and projects, inclusive of governance and best practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide oversight and guidance on effective and timely execution of staffing, reporting and forecasting resource needs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive and facilitate progress of large scale projects, drive and oversee optimization of performance, quality and cost of the delivery by defining and implementing proper resourcing, utilization, and process efficiency.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage an effective team dedicated to fulfilling the organization's mission through highly successful program implementation, team engagement and continuous improvement. Act as a point of escalation and leverage leadership to bring programs and projects back on track by bringing focus, resources, funding or other dependencies in alignment with project delivery and the interest of the company.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leverage ServiceNow as the central repository for demand, resource management, status reporting and Risk, Action items, Issues, and Decision (RAID) management; creating processes to support the technology and act as a sponsor for further tool implementation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implement and administer end-to-end project and program governance across multiple delivery streams ensuring high quality delivery including exceptional client and employee satisfaction, and meeting or exceeding financial measures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish \u002F update delivery and reporting standards, establishment and management of key performance indicators (\"KPIs\"), and other management practices and processes in alignment with Celanese strategic goals and objectives, including integration with the annual planning and budgeting processes across the PMO<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As a senior member of the IT Delivery, Operations, and OCIO, work closely and collaborate with peers, create an environment where people feel motivated, engaged, connected, able to perform at high levels, and to grow and develop in their roles. Onboard, advise, coach, manage, and mentor more to build and mature the organization<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Qualifications: \n <ul>\n  <li>Minimum of ten years expert-level knowledge of program, project and change management and associated methodologies, techniques, processes and approaches.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum five years strategic planning responsibility for a department, or organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college \u002F university; master’s degree from an accredited college \u002F university is preferred. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Consulting and\u002For Managed Services experience preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge and experience with resource management and resource staffing best practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge and experience transforming PMO to agile, resource management and budget management. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Advanced knowledge in strategic solution delivery models to ensure products and \u002F or services continue to innovate and drive continuous improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Exceptional verbal \u002F written communication, interpersonal, collaboration, negotiation, facilitation and influencing skills to lead an environment driven by business partnership, collaboration and teamwork; ability to direct, motivate and empower others to work towards the organization’s goals, ensuring efficient allocation of resources across multiple functions; lead and ensure execution of strategic initiatives for the organization; ability to address emerging opportunities and how organizations should be organized \u002F staffed to realize them.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience leading an IT PMO along with the skills to effectively manage a team and execute plans with a focus on quality.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong relationship and stakeholder management skills - experience in working as a trusted advisor at senior business leader level on critical, complex challenges<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to influence effectively at different organizational levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Courage and determination to challenge current practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Independent and objective thinker. Resilient and able to manage challenge and resistance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Comfortable managing multiple responsibilities within a fast-paced environment. Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and timelines. Effectively coordinate multiple projects with interrelated teams and technology simultaneously within aggressive timelines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prior leadership experience working seamlessly in a global organization across multiple time zones and cultures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <b><br> Functional\u002FTechnical Qualifications:<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Agile Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. Overview: \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <p> Celanese Corporation is a global chemical leader in the production of differentiated chemistry solutions and specialty materials used in most major industries and consumer applications. Our businesses use the full breadth of Celanese's global chemistry, technology and commercial expertise to create value for our customers, employees, shareholders and the corporation. As we partner with our customers to solve their most critical business needs, we strive to make a positive impact on our communities and the world through The Celanese Foundation. Based in Dallas, Celanese employs approximately 13,000 employees worldwide and had 2021 net sales of $8.5 billion. For more information about Celanese Corporation and its product offerings, visit www.celanese.com.<\u002Fp> Responsibilities: \n <ul>\n  <li>Based on project requirements, communicates team member needs to site supervision to execute the project. Provides timing and direction to this team in order to achieve cost and timing of project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads decisions on contracting strategy and selection of contractor(s).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for controlling costs, forecasting spending and reporting schedules to Site supervision. Provides detailed engineering design for plant additions and modifications via contract design group. Coordinates\u002Fmanages contract in-house or off-site engineering and design efforts during engineering, design and drafting phases of project life.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in project Safety Reviews (MSR), Management of Change (MOC) process, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR) and other hand-over activities. Assists in start-up, SOP development and training as required. Responsible for ensuring all engineering, maintenance and operational documentation is filed and available at time of startup. Manages updates to SAP, spare parts selection and stocking efforts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writes specifications for equipment, evaluates vendor’s bids, and selects equipment. Manages these purchases to insure delivery, specification compliance and cost and forecast control. Provides engineering consulting services to Site. Reviews new project feasibility and provides innovative use of technology. Performs technical design reviews for instrument, electrical and analyzer design packages.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversees and manages construction activities related to projects. Checks for compliance with approved specifications and designs. Performs appropriate construction checkout and readiness reviews before PSSR. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>Qualifications: \n <p><b> Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> BS in Electrical Engineering is preferred. candidate will have between eight (8) and ten (10)+ years experience in a related role<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge of successful project management practices such as cost control, estimating, scheduling programs (MS Project or Primavera), and forecasting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated knowledge of specifying and installation of electrical equipment and instrumentation <p><b>Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> HIRING IMMEDIATELY<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Starting wage for this position to $22.27 + $1.25 differential for 3rd shift.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Sign on Bonus of $1,500 ($500 paid out on day 1)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Plus great perks like Kona Ice, On Site Showers and Locker Rooms, Weekly Food Trucks and more...<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. For us, this is not just a job for our employees but a career that they can develop and grow within the company. We are focused on the safety of our employees, a competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and we emphasize giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Production Operator position is an extrusion machine operator that requires broad knowledge of production processes, equipment troubleshooting, equipment operation, packaging procedures, health and safety policies, and quality policies. The Production Operator role is key in the production of quality products in safe manner every day.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Production Operator duties may include: Blending\u002Fpreparing materials required for production run, staging materials required for production run, operating\u002Ftroubleshooting extrusion process, and packaging finished product to customer specification.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Safely drive fork trucks and actively participate in housekeeping for the work area.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Setting up one or two extruders to run a product that is in accordance with standard operating conditions with minimal downtime and loss of product<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitors and troubleshoots during the extrusion process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> If safety or quality issues develop, stops process and actively participates in problem-solving with shift supervisor, maintenance, safety and other operators<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completes product turn-arounds, which includes cleaning the extruder barrel and screws, the feeder, the pelletizer, the classifier, the reclaimer system, the automatic bagger, and feed and product totes to prevent product contamination<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintaining proper records, which includes run logs\u002Fsheet, feed blends on line, amount of product in totes, packaging reports, work orders, log books and keeping the on-coming operator informed as to important issues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and understanding of the policies and procedures contained in standard operating procedures, hazardous communication and waste disposal procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assume personal responsibility for complying with all safety\u002Fhealth related policies and procedures, participate in company sponsored safety programs and activities, and report to management those conditions or actions by employees or others that might create a hazard to themselves or others in the plant<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Qualification<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> High school education or GED<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> 5 years of manufacturing experience may be considered as meeting education requirement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum of 3 years of experience in a manufacturing environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Extrusion experience preferred<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Must maintain a valid driver’s license for operation of a fork-lift<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous fork-lift experience a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Required Knowledge\u002FSkills\u002FAbilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ability in the operation and uses of various hand tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must maintain acceptable housekeeping standards<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Good communication skills required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work individually and within a small group. Daily activities may vary based daily production needs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability and willingness to work 12-hour rotating shifts and overtime; including weekends and holidays<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physical requirements include: lifting 55-lb bags (floor to chest), working in hot &amp; cold temperatures, climbing stairs, frequent walking, standing and reaching in front of body<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Frequent climbing on\u002Foff of fork truck<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Desirable Knowledge\u002FSkills\u002FAbilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Previous manufacturing experience, especially working with plastics and extrusion process is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous work experience operating fork truck is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Basic mechanical and a sound mathematics aptitude which includes the ability to calculate percent’s, ratios, unit conversions, averages, as well as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Additional Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Celanese is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion, We prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, marital status or any other legally protected status.
